segments.text: I see the woman is so focused on that plate, she doesn't even see the water everywhere, it's like she's in her own little world, completely unaware of her surroundings.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The boy is being so sneaky, trying to get those cookies without her noticing, he's really stretching for them, he must really want those cookies.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can't believe how reckless he's being, standing on that wobbly stool like that, he's going to fall and hurt himself!
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The girl is just standing there, waiting for her share, not a care in the world, she's so trusting of her brother, it's almost cute.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wonder if they've done this before, taken cookies when they're not supposed to, they seem so practiced at it, like they've done it a hundred times.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The water is just pouring out of the sink, and she's standing right in the middle of it, drying that plate like nothing's wrong, it's almost funny how oblivious she is.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I feel like someone should really do something about all this, but who? Maybe I should be the one to step in.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: This is all so frustrating to watch, like a train wreck in slow motion, I just want to look away but I can't.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I hope she snaps out of it soon, before someone gets hurt, but I'm not holding my breath, she seems completely out of it.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can't help but feel a bit happy seeing the kids working together like that, even if it's not the best behavior, it's still sweet.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I'm really angry at the woman for not paying attention, she should be more aware of her surroundings, especially with kids around.
segments.speaker: PAR
